initial_story: the aim of this paper is to provide a classification of multilingual andplurilingual electronic lexicographic resources which would enable, one the onehand, the implementation of quantitative and qualitative criteria to produce atypological taxonomy of lexicographical tools, such as dictionaries, as opposedto platforms and websites and, on the other, the distinction of multilingualand plurilingual resources in terms of their larger or lesser prototypingdegree. in addition to offering a thorough description of the differentresources, this paper also puts forward some parameters and typologicalproposals to define and demarcate a number of electronic resources,particularly multilingual dictionaries and portals, while also outlining, andeven questioning, the object of study of multilingual and plurilinguallexicography.
stories: The proposed classification system will be based on a thorough analysis of existing multilingual and plurilingual electronic lexicographic resources, taking into account their functional and structural characteristics, as well as their degree of prototyping and implementation. The system will consist of a set of categories and subcategories that will enable the identification and description of different types of resources, including online dictionaries, lexical databases, terminological databases, and language portals. Furthermore, this paper will explore the implications of the proposed classification system for the development of future electronic lexicographic resources, and will discuss the challenges and opportunities arising from the increasing complexity and diversity of multilingual and plurilingual resources.

The classification system will also examine the role of emerging technologies, such as artificial intelligence and natural language processing, in shaping the future of electronic lexicography, and will investigate the potential benefits and limitations of integrating these technologies into multilingual and plurilingual resources. Additionally, the system will consider the social and cultural contexts in which these resources are used, and will explore the implications of the proposed classification system for language teaching, learning, and communication in multilingual and plurilingual settings. By providing a comprehensive framework for understanding and categorizing electronic lexicographic resources, this system aims to facilitate collaboration and innovation among researchers, developers, and users, and to promote the development of high-quality, user-centered resources that meet the diverse needs of language learners and users around the world.

To achieve these goals, the classification system will be designed to be flexible and adaptable, accommodating the rapid evolution of electronic lexicography and the emergence of new technologies and trends. It will also prioritize user-friendliness and accessibility, ensuring that the system is intuitive and easy to navigate for researchers, developers, and users with varying levels of technical expertise. Furthermore, the system will incorporate mechanisms for feedback and continuous improvement, allowing users to contribute to the refinement and expansion of the classification system over time. By fostering a collaborative and dynamic approach to electronic lexicography, this system has the potential to transform the way we create, use, and interact with multilingual and plurilingual resources, ultimately enhancing language learning, communication, and cultural understanding on a global scale.

To facilitate this vision, the classification system will be developed through an open and inclusive process, engaging with a diverse range of stakeholders, including lexicographers, linguists, language teachers, and developers, to ensure that it meets the needs of a broad user base. The system will also be designed to accommodate multiple languages and scripts, recognizing the importance of linguistic and cultural diversity in the digital age. Additionally, it will incorporate features that support the integration of multimedia and multimodal resources, such as images, audio, and video, to provide a more immersive and interactive learning experience. By providing a common framework for organizing and accessing language resources, the classification system will enable the creation of new applications and services that can be used across different languages and cultures, promoting greater understanding and exchange between communities worldwide.

Furthermore, the system will be built upon a flexible and modular architecture, allowing for easy updates and expansions as new languages, scripts, and resources become available. This will ensure that the classification system remains dynamic and responsive to the evolving needs of its users, while also facilitating collaboration and knowledge-sharing across linguistic and cultural boundaries. To foster a sense of community and encourage ongoing feedback, the system will also include features for user-generated content, ratings, and reviews, enabling users to contribute their expertise and experiences to the development of the system. Moreover, the system will be designed with accessibility in mind, incorporating features such as text-to-speech functionality, font size adjustment, and high contrast mode, to ensure that language resources are equally available to all users, regardless of their abilities or disabilities.

In addition, the system will prioritize data privacy and security, utilizing end-to-end encryption and secure authentication protocols to protect user data and ensure the confidentiality of sensitive information. To further promote trust and transparency, the system will provide clear guidelines and policies regarding data collection, storage, and usage, as well as mechanisms for users to request access to, correct, or delete their personal data. By prioritizing user trust and accessibility, the system aims to create a safe and inclusive environment that empowers language learners and professionals to achieve their goals, while also contributing to the advancement of linguistic knowledge and understanding.

Furthermore, the system will incorporate robust reporting and analytics tools, enabling users to track their progress, identify areas for improvement, and refine their language skills over time. Additionally, the system will facilitate collaboration and knowledge-sharing among users, allowing them to engage in peer review, participate in language exchange programs, and access a community-driven repository of language resources and learning materials. To ensure the system remains current and relevant, a dedicated team of linguists, educators, and developers will continuously review and update the platform's content, features, and functionalities, incorporating feedback from users and advances in language learning research and technology.

This iterative development process will enable the system to stay abreast of emerging trends and best practices in language education, ensuring that users have access to the most effective and engaging learning experiences possible. Moreover, the system's modular architecture will allow for seamless integration with existing learning management systems, educational platforms, and digital tools, making it an ideal solution for educational institutions, language schools, and corporations seeking to provide high-quality language training to their students, teachers, or employees.

Additionally, the system's analytics and reporting capabilities will provide valuable insights into learner behavior and progress, enabling educators and administrators to make data-driven decisions and optimize their language training programs. The system's flexibility and scalability will also enable it to support a wide range of language learning scenarios, from beginner to advanced levels, and cater to diverse learning styles and preferences. Furthermore, the system's user-friendly interface and personalized learning pathways will ensure that learners remain motivated and engaged throughout their language learning journey, leading to improved learning outcomes and increased learner satisfaction.

To further enhance the learning experience, the system will incorporate a range of interactive tools and multimedia resources, such as videos, podcasts, and gamification elements, to create an immersive and engaging environment that simulates real-life language use. Additionally, the system's social learning features will facilitate collaboration and communication among learners, enabling them to practice their language skills in a supportive and interactive community. By leveraging the latest advances in AI and machine learning, the system will also be able to adapt to the unique needs and abilities of each learner, providing a truly personalized and effective language learning experience.

This personalized approach will be further augmented by the system's ability to track learner progress and identify areas where additional support is needed, providing real-time feedback and targeted interventions to help learners overcome common language learning obstacles. Moreover, the system's virtual coaching feature will offer learners access to expert language instructors who can provide one-on-one guidance and support, helping to build confidence and fluency in their target language. As learners progress through the system, they will also have the opportunity to participate in live language exchange events, where they can engage in conversation with native speakers and receive feedback on their pronunciation and comprehension.

These events will be facilitated by the system's AI-powered moderation tools, ensuring that learners are matched with suitable language partners and that conversations remain productive and relevant to their learning goals. Additionally, the system will provide learners with a comprehensive language portfolio, where they can track their progress, set goals, and reflect on their learning journey. This portfolio will also serve as a valuable resource for educators and employers, providing a detailed and accurate assessment of a learner's language abilities. Furthermore, the system's gamification features, such as points, badges, and leaderboards, will be designed to motivate learners and foster a sense of community, encouraging them to stay engaged and committed to their language learning goals.

To further enhance the learning experience, the system will also offer a range of interactive language exercises and activities, such as quizzes, games, and role-plays, which will be tailored to the learner's level and interests. Moreover, learners will have access to a vast library of authentic language materials, including videos, podcasts, and articles, which will help them develop their reading, writing, and listening skills. The system will also provide learners with personalized feedback and corrective guidance, enabling them to identify and improve their language weaknesses and develop a more nuanced understanding of language nuances and cultural references.

Additionally, the system will incorporate a social learning component, allowing learners to interact with native speakers and fellow language enthusiasts through online discussion forums, language exchange partnerships, and virtual language clubs. This collaborative environment will foster a sense of community and motivation, as learners can share their experiences, ask questions, and learn from one another. Furthermore, the system will utilize AI-powered language analysis tools to track learners' progress, identify areas of improvement, and provide actionable recommendations for continued language development.

These tools will also enable learners to receive personalized feedback on their pronunciation, grammar, and vocabulary usage, allowing them to refine their language skills and develop a more authentic accent. Moreover, the system will include a gamification element, where learners can earn badges and rewards for achieving language milestones, completing challenges, and participating in language-based activities, further enhancing their engagement and motivation. This library will be regularly updated with new content, ensuring that learners have access to the most relevant and contemporary language materials, and can stay up-to-date with the latest trends and developments in the language.
